docs.content:
PokedBots Racing - Technical Reference

Deep Technical Documentation

Navigation

üìñ ‚Üê MCP Tools | üìñ Back to Overview

Automated Processes

Race Scheduler Timer

Status: Not yet implemented (manual race creation via RaceCalendar) Planned Frequency: Every 1-2 hours

Planned Logic:

  • Create 2-3 races scheduled 6-24 hours ahead
  • Randomize distance (5-50km), terrain, class
  • Set entry fees based on class (base √ó multiplier):
    • Scavenger: 1x base (0.05-0.2 ICP)
    • Raider: 2x base (0.1-0.4 ICP)
    • Elite: 5x base (0.25-1.0 ICP)
    • SilentKlan: 10x base (0.5-2.0 ICP)
  • Apply 5% platform tax to prize pool
  • Apply platform bonuses (Scavenger/Raider only):
    • Daily Sprints: +0.5 ICP
    • Weekly Leagues: +2 ICP
    • Monthly Cups: +5 ICP (Elite/SilentKlan)
  • SilentKlan races restricted to GodClass/Master with 10+ wins

Race Execution Timer

Status: Implemented via timer-tool Trigger: Race startTime reached

Logic:

  1. Find races with status=#Upcoming and startTime <= now
  2. Change status to #InProgress
  3. Run deterministic simulation:
    • Calculate race time for each participant
    • Apply terrain bonuses/penalties
    • Add randomness (seed: raceId + startTime)
    • Sort by completion time
  4. Distribute prizes:
    • 1st: 50% of prize pool
    • 2nd: 30% of prize pool
    • 3rd: 20% of prize pool
  5. Update bot stats:
    • Increment racesEntered
    • Increment wins/places/shows
    • Add prize to totalScrapEarned
    • Reduce condition by 15
  6. Change status to #Completed

Note: Uses IC randomness beacon for deterministic seed generation

Upgrade Completion Timer

Status: Implemented via timer-tool Trigger: Individual upgrade session endsAt timestamp

Logic:

  1. Scheduled when upgrade starts (endsAt = startedAt + 12 hours)
  2. On completion:
    • Roll stat gain: 1-3 points base
    • Apply faction modifiers:
      • UltimateMaster: 50% chance for 2x gain
      • Wild Bot: ¬±10% variance (can be 0 or higher)
      • Others: Standard gain
    • Add bonus to appropriate stat (speedBonus/powerCoreBonus/etc.)
    • Add 50 XP
    • Clear upgradeEndsAt timestamp
    • Remove from activeUpgrades map

Robot Decay System

Status: ‚úÖ Implemented Frequency: Every hour (self-rescheduling timer)

Logic:

  • Runs on ALL initialized bots (not just inactive ones)
  • Condition decay: ~0.21 per hour (~5 per day)
  • Calibration decay: ~0.125 per hour (~3 per day)
  • Faction modifiers:
    • Wild Bot: 20% faster decay (chaotic systems)
    • UltimateMaster: 40% slower decay (supreme construction)
    • Others: Standard decay rate
  • Minimum values: condition 30, calibration 30
  • Drives maintenance economy (forces recharge/repair usage)

Data Structures

Key Types

// PokedBots-specific racing stats
type PokedBotRacingStats = {
  tokenIndex: Nat;
  ownerPrincipal: Principal;
  faction: FactionType;  // UltimateMaster/Wild/Golden/Ultimate/Blackhole/Dead/Master/Bee/Food/Box/Murder/Game/Animal/Industrial
  
  // Upgrade bonuses (from scrapyard upgrades)
  speedBonus: Nat;
  powerCoreBonus: Nat;
  accelerationBonus: Nat;
  stabilityBonus: Nat;
  
  // Dynamic stats
  battery: Nat;         // 0-100, drains by 10 per race
  condition: Nat;       // 0-100, affects performance
  calibration: Nat;     // 0-100, initial 80
  experience: Nat;      // XP earned from races/upgrades
  
  // Preferences (derived from metadata)
  preferredDistance: Distance;  // ShortSprint/MediumHaul/LongTrek
  preferredTerrain: Terrain;    // ScrapHeaps/WastelandSand/MetalRoads
  
  // Career stats
  racesEntered: Nat;
  wins: Nat;
  places: Nat;          // 2nd place finishes
  shows: Nat;           // 3rd place finishes
  totalScrapEarned: Nat;
  factionReputation: Nat;
  
  // Timestamps
  activatedAt: Int;
  lastRecharged: ?Int;  // 6-hour cooldown
  lastRepaired: ?Int;   // 12-hour cooldown
  lastDiagnostics: ?Int;
  lastRaced: ?Int;
  upgradeEndsAt: ?Int;  // 12-hour upgrade duration
  listedForSale: Bool;  // Marketplace listing status
};

// Generic racing stats (used by simulator)
type RacingStats = {
  speed: Nat;          // 30-100
  powerCore: Nat;      // 30-100 (endurance)
  acceleration: Nat;   // 30-100
  stability: Nat;      // 30-100
};

type Race = {
  raceId: Nat;
  name: Text;               // e.g., "Wasteland Sprint #42"
  distance: Nat;            // km
  terrain: Terrain;         // ScrapHeaps/WastelandSand/MetalRoads
  raceClass: RaceClass;     // Scavenger/Raider/Elite/SilentKlan
  entryFee: Nat;            // ICP e8s
  maxEntries: Nat;          // Usually 10
  startTime: Int;
  duration: Nat;            // Race duration in seconds
  entryDeadline: Int;       // 30 min before startTime
  createdAt: Int;
  entries: [RaceEntry];     // Participants
  status: RaceStatus;       // Upcoming/InProgress/Completed/Cancelled
  results: ?[RaceResult];   // Post-race results
  prizePool: Nat;           // Total prize (entry fees + sponsors)
  platformTax: Nat;         // 5% tax (was silentKlanTax)
  sponsors: [Sponsor];      // Race sponsors
};

type RaceEntry = {
  nftId: Text;              // Token index as text
  owner: Principal;
  entryFee: Nat;
  enteredAt: Int;
};

type RaceResult = {
  nftId: Text;
  owner: Principal;
  position: Nat;            // 1st, 2nd, 3rd...
  finalTime: Float;         // Race completion time
  prizeAmount: Nat;         // ICP e8s won
};

type Sponsor = {
  sponsor: Principal;
  amount: Nat;              // ICP e8s contributed
  message: ?Text;           // Optional message (max 100 chars)
  timestamp: Int;
};

type UpgradeType = {
  #Velocity;      // +Speed
  #PowerCore;     // +Power Core
  #Thruster;      // +Acceleration
  #Gyro;          // +Stability
};

type UpgradeSession = {
  tokenIndex: Nat;
  upgradeType: UpgradeType;
  startedAt: Int;
  endsAt: Int;              // startedAt + 12 hours
};

// Faction bonuses during upgrades
// UltimateMaster: 50% chance for 2x stat gain
// Wild Bot: ¬±10% variance (unstable)
// Others: Standard 1-3 stat points

Stable Variables

// Garage Manager state
stable var stable_garageStats: Map.Map<Nat, PokedBotRacingStats>;
stable var stable_activeUpgrades: Map.Map<Nat, UpgradeSession>;

// Race Manager state
stable var stable_races: Map.Map<Nat, Race>;
stable var stable_nextRaceId: Nat = 1;

// Leaderboard state
stable var stable_leaderboardEntries: [(Principal, LeaderboardEntry)];

// NFT Stats Manager state (base stats from metadata)
stable var stable_nftStats: Map.Map<Nat, NFTStats>;
stable var stable_schema: TraitSchema;

// Marketplace cache
stable var stable_marketplaceCache: ?{
  listings: [(Nat32, ExtIntegration.Listing, ExtIntegration.Metadata)];
  cachedAt: Int;
};
stable var stable_marketplaceCacheTTL: Int = 300_000_000_000;  // 5 minutes

Security Considerations

Randomness

  • Uses IC randomness beacon
  • Race seed: raceId + startTime + blockHash
  • Deterministic for same inputs

Authorization

  • All operations verify NFT ownership
  • Calls bearer(tokenId) on EXT canister
  • Cached principal verified before actions

Economic Safeguards

  • Entry fee scaling by class (1x/2x/5x/10x multiplier)
  • Prize pool validation
  • Platform 5% tax on all races
  • Platform bonuses for beginner classes (Scavenger/Raider)
  • ICRC-2 approval amounts checked

Data Integrity

  • Stable variables for persistence
  • Ownership checks before mutations
  • Race status prevents double-entry
  • Upgrade cooldowns enforced

ICRC-2 Transfer Security

  • All transfers use exact amounts
  • Fee included in calculations
  • Two-step marketplace settlement
  • Garage subaccount intermediary

Dependencies

Motoko Packages (mops.toml)

[dependencies]
base = "0.11.1"
map = "9.0.1"
http-types = "1.0.3"
ic = "1.0.1"
sha2 = "0.0.2"
json = "1.0.2"
mcp-motoko-sdk = "https://github.com/rvanasa/mcp-motoko-sdk#v0.2.5"
timer-tool = "1.1.0"
icrc2-types = "0.1.0"
base16 = "1.0.0"
class-plus = "0.1.0"
star = "0.3.3"

External Canisters

ICP Ledger:

  • ID: ryjl3-tyaaa-aaaaa-aaaba-cai
  • Used for: ICRC-2 transfers, legacy transfers
  • Methods:
    • icrc2_transfer_from: Pull ICP from user (with approval)
    • transfer: Legacy transfer (garage to marketplace)

PokedBots EXT NFT & Marketplace:

  • ID: bzsui-sqaaa-aaaah-qce2a-cai
  • Used for: NFT ownership, metadata, marketplace operations
  • Methods:
    • tokens(accountId): Get owned token indices
    • bearer(tokenId): Get token owner account ID
    • metadata(tokenId): Get NFT metadata
    • details(tokenId): Get listing details
    • lock(tokenId, price, buyer, subaccount): Lock NFT for purchase
    • settle(tokenId): Complete purchase settlement
    • list({token, from_subaccount, price}): List/unlist NFT
    • transfer(...): Transfer NFT between accounts

Integration Notes:

  • All ownership checks use bearer() as source of truth
  • Token identifiers are EXT-encoded (canister + index)
  • Account identifiers are 32-byte hex strings
  • Garage subaccounts use "GARG" prefix + principal bytes

Token Economics

ICP Flows

Inflows:

  • Race entry fees (class-based scaling):
    • Scavenger: 0.05-0.2 ICP
    • Raider: 0.1-0.4 ICP
    • Elite: 0.25-1.0 ICP
    • SilentKlan: 0.5-2.0 ICP
  • Race sponsorships (min 0.1 ICP)
  • Recharge payments (0.1 ICP + 0.0001 fee)
  • Repair payments (0.05 ICP + 0.0001 fee)
  • Upgrade payments (3.33 ICP per part + 0.0001 fee):
    • First upgrade: 10 ICP (3 parts)
    • Second upgrade: 17 ICP (5 parts)
    • Third upgrade: 27 ICP (8 parts)
  • NFT purchases (marketplace price + 0.0002 fee)

Outflows:

  • Race prizes (after 5% platform tax):
    • 1st place: 47.5% of prize pool
    • 2nd place: 23.75% of prize pool
    • 3rd place: 14.25% of prize pool
    • 4th place: 9.5% of prize pool
  • Platform bonuses:
    • Daily Sprints: +0.5 ICP (Scavenger/Raider)
    • Weekly Leagues: +2 ICP (Scavenger/Raider)
    • Monthly Cups: +5 ICP (Elite/SilentKlan)
  • Platform tax: 5% of entry fees (held in canister)

Performance Optimizations

Marketplace Caching

  • 5-minute TTL
  • Reduces EXT canister calls
  • Cursor-based pagination

Ownership Caching

  • Principal cached in racing stats
  • Verified before operations
  • Reduces EXT bearer() calls

Batch Processing

  • Timers process multiple items
  • Race simulations batched
  • Decay applied in bulk

Development Phases

Phase 1: Marketplace Integration ‚úÖ

  • Browse/purchase PokedBots
  • Garage subaccount system
  • ICRC-2 payment flow

Phase 2: Racing Engine ‚úÖ

  • Race calendar
  • Simulation engine
  • Prize distribution

Phase 3: Maintenance & Upgrades ‚úÖ

  • Recharge/repair tools
  • Upgrade system
  • Decay mechanics

Phase 4: Leaderboards & Polish ‚úÖ

  • Career stats tracking
  • Faction rankings
  • Sponsorship system

Future: Scrapyard System üî®

  • Multi-collection browser
  • Smart valuation
  • Parts economy
  • Progressive upgrades

Success Metrics

User Engagement

  • Active racers per week
  • Races per bot
  • Average session duration

Economic Activity

  • ICP volume in races
  • Marketplace purchases
  • Upgrade spending

NFT Utility

  • Bots initialized for racing
  • Win rate distribution
  • Faction popularity

Navigation

üìñ ‚Üê MCP Tools | üìñ Back to Overview

Complete Documentation:

  • üìñ Overview - Start here
  • üèóÔ∏è Architecture - Design decisions
  • üîß Garage System - Bot management
  • ‚ö° Upgrade System - Scrapyard & parts
  • üèÅ Racing System - Races & prizes
  • üõí Marketplace - Buy & trade
  • üõ†Ô∏è MCP Tools - API reference

metadata.title: Complete Beginner's Guide
metadata.description: Everything you need to know to start racing, managing, and upgrading your robot NFTs

guides.content:
PokedBots Racing - Complete Beginner's Guide

THE BASICS

You own robot NFTs that race against each other for ICP prizes. Each bot has 4 stats that determine performance:

  • Speed - Top speed on straightaways
  • Acceleration - How fast you reach top speed
  • Power Core - Energy efficiency (less battery drain)
  • Stability - Consistency & durability

HOW RACING WORKS

1. Find a Race

Races are scheduled at specific times (every 6 hours). Each race has a class (Junker/Raider/Elite/SilentKlan based on your bot's ELO rating), terrain type, and prize pool.

2. Pay Entry Fee

Small ICP fee to enter (0.1-0.2 ICP typically). Up to 12 bots per race.

3. Race Happens Automatically

At race time, the system simulates the race based on all bots' stats, condition, battery, terrain bonuses, and RNG.

4. Winners Get Paid

Top finishers split the prize pool (1st gets most, 2nd/3rd get smaller cuts).

KEY MECHANICS

Battery (Energy)

Drains each race. Low battery = HUGE speed/accel penalties. At 50% battery you lose ~25% performance.

  • Recharge: 0.1 ICP, restores 75 battery, 6hr cooldown

Condition (Health)

Wears down each race. Low condition = inconsistent performance (wild RNG swings).

  • Repair: 0.05 ICP, restores 25 condition, 3hr cooldown

Terrain Bonuses

Each bot prefers one terrain type (ScrapHeaps/WastelandSand/MetalRoads). Racing on your preferred terrain = +5% all stats.

Factions

Each bot belongs to a faction with unique bonuses (Dead/Master/Blackhole/etc). These give stat boosts, terrain bonuses, or special abilities.

STRATEGY TIPS

  • Keep battery above 80% for full performance
  • Match your bot to races on their preferred terrain
  • Higher-rated bots enter higher-class races with bigger prizes
  • You can race while upgrading or scavenging (multitask!)

MAINTENANCE

  • Scavenging - Send bots on 5h/11h/23h missions to gather upgrade parts (no ICP cost, just battery)
  • Upgrading - Spend parts to permanently increase stats (12hr sessions)
  • Both can happen while racing!

Racing Brackets (Classes) - Complete Guide

HOW BRACKETS WORK

Your bot's ELO rating determines which class of races you can enter. ELO goes up when you win, down when you lose. Think of it like a skill-based matchmaking system.

4 RACING CLASSES

JUNKER CLASS (Beginner)

  • ELO Range: 1200-1499
  • Entry Point: New bots start at 1200-1400 ELO (based on rating quality)
  • Exit Point: Win enough to reach 1500 ELO ‚Üí promoted to Raider
  • Prize Pools: Smallest (0.50-0.65 ICP typical)
  • Competition: Weakest bots, easiest wins

RAIDER CLASS (Intermediate)

  • ELO Range: 1500-1699
  • Entry Point: Promoted from Junker at 1500 ELO, OR new bots with 20-60 rating start here
  • Exit Point: Win to 1700 ELO ‚Üí Elite | Lose below 1500 ‚Üí demoted to Junker
  • Prize Pools: Medium (0.80-1.10 ICP typical)
  • Competition: Mid-tier bots

ELITE CLASS (Advanced)

  • ELO Range: 1700-1899
  • Entry Point: Promoted from Raider at 1700 ELO, OR new bots with 60+ rating start at 1800 ELO
  • Exit Point: Win to 1900 ELO ‚Üí SilentKlan | Lose below 1700 ‚Üí demoted to Raider
  • Prize Pools: Large (0.75-1.40 ICP typical)
  • Competition: Strong bots, tougher field

SILENTKLAN CLASS (Elite/Pro)

  • ELO Range: 1900+
  • Entry Point: Promoted from Elite at 1900 ELO
  • Exit Point: Lose below 1900 ‚Üí demoted to Elite
  • Prize Pools: Largest (varies, top-tier competition)
  • Competition: Best bots only

KEY POINTS

  • You can ONLY enter races in your current class
  • Winning = +ELO, Losing = -ELO (amount varies by opponent strength)
  • Better bots start in higher classes (based on initial rating)
  • Prize pools scale with class difficulty
  • Can't "sandbag" in lower classes - ELO forces you up

Common Commands

Here are easy natural language commands you can use:

Garage & Status

  • "Show garage and stats with cooldowns"
  • "View my inventory / parts"
  • "Show me financials"

Racing

  • "What races are available?"
  • "What races am I in?"
  • "Put me into race #32"
  • "Please simulate my next race with (name)"

Upgrades & Strategy

  • "What should I upgrade for the most efficiency?"
  • "Elaborate on stats"
  • "Elaborate on cooldowns"

Scavenging

  • "Send (name) on 5hr scav to dead machine"
  • "Complete scavenging for (name)"

Scavenging - Beginner's Guide

What Is It?

Send your bots into the wasteland to gather upgrade parts. No ICP cost - just battery and condition wear. You can scavenge while racing!

3 Mission Lengths

  • ShortExpedition (5h): 15-35 parts, costs 10 battery
  • DeepSalvage (11h): 40-80 parts, costs 20 battery
  • WastelandExpedition (23h): 100-200 parts, costs 40 battery

3 Danger Zones (you choose)

  • ScrapHeaps: Safe (normal rewards, 40% universal parts)
  • AbandonedSettlements: Moderate risk (1.4x parts, 1.15x condition damage, 25% universal)
  • DeadMachineFields: High danger (2x parts, 1.3x condition damage, only 10% universal)

Part Types

  • Speed Chips, Power Core Fragments, Thruster Kits, Gyro Modules
  • Universal Parts - Can substitute for any type when upgrading

Why Risk Matters

Higher danger zones give MORE specialized parts but LESS universal parts. If you need specific parts for upgrades, go dangerous. If you want flexibility, stay safe.

World Buffs (15% chance)

Random bonus stats for your next race! Longer missions = bigger buffs. Expires in 48h if unused.

Pro Tips

  • High Power Core stat = less battery drain
  • High Stability = less condition damage in dangerous zones
  • Dead faction bots get 1.4x parts in DeadMachineFields + take 50% less condition damage (perfect scavengers!)
  • You can race while scavenging, but if your race starts before mission ends, you'll take penalties

Upgrade Parts - Complete Guide

WHAT ARE PARTS?

Currency for upgrading your bot's stats permanently. You gather them through scavenging missions (no ICP cost) or buy upgrades directly with ICP.

5 PART TYPES

  • Speed Chips ‚Üí Upgrade Speed (Velocity)
  • Power Core Fragments ‚Üí Upgrade Power Core
  • Thruster Kits ‚Üí Upgrade Acceleration (Thruster)
  • Gyro Modules ‚Üí Upgrade Stability (Gyro)
  • Universal Parts ‚Üí Can substitute for ANY type (most valuable!)

UPGRADE COSTS (Escalating)

  • 1st upgrade: 100 parts
  • 2nd upgrade: 200 parts
  • 3rd upgrade: 300 parts
  • 4th upgrade: 900 parts
  • 5th upgrade: 2,700 parts
  • 6th upgrade: 8,100 parts

Note: These costs may be adjusted for balance

STAT GAINS (RNG-based)

  • 1st upgrade: +1 to +3 points (guaranteed at least +1)
  • 2nd-3rd: +1 to +2 points (guaranteed at least +1)
  • 4th+: Usually +1 point (can be 0 if unlucky)

Faction bonuses can double your gains (20-35% chance depending on rarity).

DIFFICULTY SCALING

Higher stats = harder to upgrade. At 60+ you get reduced gains, at 90+ only 20% effectiveness.

STRATEGY

  • Use Universal Parts for expensive upgrades (900+)
  • Scavenge in dangerous zones for 2x specialized parts
  • Scavenge in safe zones for more Universal Parts (40% vs 10%)
  • Upgrade takes 12 hours but you can race during it!

Example: Upgrading a bot's Speed (1st upgrade) costs 100 Speed Chips or 100 Universal Parts, takes 12h, gives +1 to +3 Speed.

PokedBots - All In-Game Costs

INITIAL SETUP

  • Register bot for racing license: 0.1 ICP (one-time per bot)

MAINTENANCE (Recurring)

  • Recharge battery (+75 battery): 0.1 ICP (6hr cooldown)
  • Repair condition (+25 condition): 0.05 ICP (3hr cooldown)

RACING

  • Race entry fees: 0.1-0.2 ICP (varies by race)
  • Battery drain per race: 10-20 battery (depends on distance, terrain, Power Core stat)
  • Condition wear per race: 3-7 condition (depends on distance, terrain, finish position)

UPGRADES (12hr sessions)

Pay with parts OR ICP:

  • 1st upgrade: 100 parts or ~0.5 ICP
  • 2nd upgrade: 200 parts or ~1.0 ICP
  • 3rd upgrade: 300 parts or ~1.5 ICP
  • 4th upgrade: 900 parts or ~4.5 ICP
  • 5th upgrade: 2,700 parts or ~13.5 ICP
  • 6th upgrade: 8,100 parts or ~40.5 ICP

SCAVENGING (No ICP Cost!)

  • ShortExpedition (5h): 10 battery, ~5 condition
  • DeepSalvage (11h): 20 battery, ~10 condition
  • WastelandExpedition (23h): 40 battery, ~20 condition

Multiplied by zone difficulty: ScrapHeaps 1.0x, AbandonedSettlements 1.15x, DeadMachineFields 1.3x

MARKETPLACE

  • List bot for sale: Free
  • Transfer bot: Free
  • Purchase bot: Varies (seller sets price)

Note: All ICP transactions include small 0.0001 ICP transfer fee

How to Shop for Bots on the Marketplace

WHAT TO LOOK FOR

  • Rating 40+ = Elite starter (1600 ELO), expensive (77+ ICP)
  • Rating 30-40 = Raider starter (1400 ELO), mid-price
  • Rating <30 = Junker starter (1200 ELO), cheap (7-10 ICP)
  • Terrain preference = Match to common race types
  • Balanced stats = More consistent than specialists
  • Faction bonuses = Dead (scavenging), Blackhole (speed), Master (balanced)

USEFUL COMMANDS

  • "Show me the cheapest bots with the highest total base rating."
  • "Show me bots under 10 ICP"
  • "Browse PokedBots by faction"
  • "Find Dead faction bots for sale"

Garage Management - Balancing Races & Scavenging

THE CORE STRATEGY

Maximize income (race prizes) while gathering free parts (scavenging). Both can happen simultaneously!

RACE-FIRST APPROACH (Recommended)

  1. Enter races when available - Races happen every 6 hours, limited spots
  2. Fill downtime with scavenging - Between races, send bots on missions
  3. Time scavenging to finish BEFORE races - Avoid withdrawal penalties

TIMING EXAMPLES

Scenario 1: Race in 8 hours

Start 5h scavenge now ‚Üí completes 3h before race ‚Üí recharge/repair if needed ‚Üí race fresh

Scenario 2: Race in 14 hours

Start 11h scavenge now ‚Üí completes 3h before race ‚Üí prep for race

Scenario 3: No races scheduled

Start 23h scavenge ‚Üí maximize parts gathering

SCAVENGING WHILE RACING (Advanced)

You CAN race while scavenging, BUT if race starts before mission ends:

  • Partial parts awarded (with 50% penalty)
  • Condition damage scales with progress
  • NOT profitable for early withdrawals

Only do this if: Race prize is worth more than lost parts + condition damage

BATTERY/CONDITION MANAGEMENT

Before Racing

  • Keep battery 80%+ (recharge if below)
  • Keep condition 90%+ (repair if needed)
  • Cost: 0.1 ICP recharge + 0.05 ICP repair = 0.15 ICP maintenance

After Racing

  • Battery drains 10-20 per race
  • Condition wears 3-7 per race
  • Can usually do 3-4 races before needing maintenance

OPTIMAL ROTATION (5 bots example)

Bot 1-2: Racing focus

  • Enter every available race in their class
  • Scavenge 5h missions between races
  • Maintain 80%+ battery/condition

Bot 3-4: Scavenge focus

  • Run 11h or 23h missions constantly
  • Enter races only when convenient
  • Lower maintenance costs

Bot 5: Flex/Upgrade

  • Rotate through 12h upgrades
  • Can still race while upgrading
  • Scavenge when not upgrading

PRO TIPS

  • Dead faction bots = best scavengers (1.4x parts in DeadMachineFields)
  • High Power Core = less battery drain = more races between recharges
  • Enter races early (12 spots fill up fast for good prizes)
  • Track cooldowns - recharge/repair immediately when available if racing soon

guides.content:
Beginner's Guide to PokedBots Racing üèÅ

Your First Steps in the Wasteland - November 29, 2025

Welcome to PokedBots Racing! This guide will help you understand the game, pick your first bot, and start racing without breaking the bank.

üìö Table of Contents

  1. Understanding the Basics
  2. The 14 Factions Explained
  3. Reading Bot Stats
  4. Budget Recommendations
  5. Your First Purchase
  6. Quick Start Race Strategy
  7. Common Beginner Mistakes

Understanding the Basics

What is PokedBots Racing?

PokedBots Racing is a competitive NFT racing game where:

  • Each bot is a unique NFT with different stats and traits
  • Stats determine performance in races (speed, power, acceleration, stability)
  • You can buy, race, upgrade, and trade your bots
  • Races have prizes and build your bot's reputation

Key Terms

  • ICP: Internet Computer Protocol tokens - the currency used to buy bots
  • Faction: Your bot's type category (14 total factions with different bonuses)
  • Rating: Overall bot quality score (20-100 scale)
  • Base Stats: The four core racing stats (Speed, Power, Acceleration, Stability)
  • Terrain: Race track type (MetalRoads, WastelandSand, ScrapHeaps)

The 14 Factions Explained

PokedBots now has 14 distinct factions organized into 4 rarity tiers. Each faction gives unique stat bonuses:

üåü Ultra-Rare Tier (1-45 bots each)

Ultimate-Master (1 bot total)

Bonuses: +25 to ALL stats
Best For: The ultimate collector's item, guaranteed #1 ranking
Availability: Only 1 exists!

Wild (5 bots total)

Bonuses: +24 Acceleration, +22 Speed, +18 Power/Stability
Best For: Elite speed and agility specialists
Availability: Extremely rare, only 5 exist

Golden (27 bots total)

Bonuses: +18 Power Core, +16 Stability, +14 Speed/Acceleration
Best For: Balanced premium racers
Availability: Very rare

Ultimate (45 bots total)

Bonuses: +12 Speed/Power Core, +8 Acceleration/Stability
Best For: Competitive balanced racing
Availability: Very rare

‚ö° Super-Rare Tier (244-640 bots each)

Blackhole (244 bots)

Bonuses: +18 Power Core, +16 Acceleration, +13 Speed/Stability
Best For: Endurance and technical courses
Strengths: Highest power bonus in game, elite acceleration
Recommended For: Players wanting super-rare prestige

Dead (382 bots)

Bonuses: +10 Stability, +9 Power Core, +7 Speed/Acceleration
Best For: Rough terrain and long races
Strengths: Top stability, strong endurance
Recommended For: WastelandSand specialists

Master (640 bots)

Bonuses: +11 Speed/Stability, +8 Power/Acceleration
Best For: Balanced high-performance racing
Strengths: Excellent all-around bonuses
Recommended For: Competitive players (most accessible super-rare)

üî∏ Rare Tier (717-999 bots each)

Bee (717 bots)

Bonuses: +6 Acceleration, +5 Speed, +3 Power/Stability
Best For: Quick starts and agility
Recommended For: Acceleration-focused strategies

Food (858 bots)

Bonuses: +6 Power Core, +5 Acceleration, +3 Speed/Stability
Best For: Power and acceleration combo
Recommended For: Medium-haul endurance

Box (999 bots)

Bonuses: +3 Speed/Acceleration/Stability, +2 Power
Best For: Balanced rare faction
Recommended For: Versatile racing

Murder (999 bots)

Bonuses: +3 Speed/Acceleration/Stability, +1 Power
Best For: Balanced racing
Recommended For: Any terrain

üîπ Common Tier (1654-2009 bots each) - BEST FOR BEGINNERS

Game (1654 bots)

Bonuses: +1 Acceleration/Speed, +0 Power/Stability
Best For: New players, learning mechanics
Strengths: Affordable entry point
Recommended For: Your first bot

Animal (1836 bots)

Bonuses: +1 Stability/Power, +0 Speed/Acceleration
Best For: Stability and endurance
Strengths: Affordable, rough terrain capable
Recommended For: WastelandSand beginners

Industrial (2009 bots)

Bonuses: +1 Power/Stability, +0 Speed/Acceleration
Best For: Endurance racing
Strengths: Most common, affordable, reliable
Recommended For: Budget endurance racers

Reading Bot Stats

Every bot has four core stats (range: 20-100 after faction bonuses):

üöÄ Speed (SPD)

  • How fast your bot moves on straightaways
  • Most important for: Short sprint races, flat tracks
  • Good range: 35-45 (excellent: 45+)

‚ö° Power Core (PWR)

  • Your bot's energy and endurance
  • Most important for: Long races, sustained performance
  • Good range: 35-45 (excellent: 45+)

üèÉ Acceleration (ACC)

  • How quickly your bot reaches top speed
  • Most important for: Race starts, recovery from obstacles
  • Good range: 35-45 (excellent: 45+)

üéØ Stability (STB)

  • How well your bot handles rough terrain and obstacles
  • Most important for: WastelandSand/ScrapHeaps, bad weather
  • Good range: 35-45 (excellent: 45+)

üìä Overall Rating

The average of all four stats:

  • 20-30: Poor quality (avoid)
  • 31-35: Below average (budget practice bots)
  • 36-40: Good (solid for beginners)
  • 41-45: Excellent (competitive racing)
  • 46-50: Elite (top performers)
  • 51+: Ultra-elite (very rare)

Budget Recommendations

Ultra Budget: 16-30 ICP

Goal: Get racing ASAP without spending much
Expected Quality: 26-36 rating (entry-level bots)

Top Picks:

Token #5100 - Best Starter Bot ‚≠ê

  • Price: 16.00 ICP
  • Faction: üçî Food (Rare tier)
  • Rating: 26/100
  • Stats: SPD 24 | PWR 26 | ACC 26 | STB 30
  • Why: Cheapest entry with decent stats, Food faction +6 Power bonus
  • Perfect For: Learning race mechanics on a budget

Token #4525 - Super-Rare Master!

  • Price: 20.00 ICP
  • Faction: üëë Master (Super-Rare tier!)
  • Rating: 34/100
  • Stats: SPD 36 | PWR 37 | ACC 31 | STB 33
  • Why: Super-rare faction prestige at budget price! +11 SPD/STB, +8 PWR/ACC bonuses
  • Perfect For: Players wanting rare faction status

Token #1489 - Dead Speed Specialist

  • Price: 30.00 ICP
  • Faction: ‚ò†Ô∏è Dead (Super-Rare tier!)
  • Rating: 36/100
  • Stats: SPD 39 | PWR 31 | ACC 36 | STB 39
  • Why: Strong balanced stats with super-rare Dead faction (+10 STB, +9 PWR, +7 SPD/ACC)
  • Perfect For: Balanced racing beginners who want super-rare prestige

Enthusiast Budget: 40-50 ICP

Goal: Get premium quality with elite factions
Expected Quality: 35-41 rating (competitive performers)

Top Picks:

Token #4343 - Blackhole Power Monster! ‚≠ê‚≠ê

  • Price: 44.00 ICP
  • Faction: ‚ö´ Blackhole (Super-Rare tier!)
  • Rating: 41/100 üèÜ
  • Stats: SPD 35 | PWR 46 | ACC 41 | STB 41
  • Why: BEST VALUE SUPER-RARE! Blackhole faction has highest Power bonus in game (+18 PWR, +16 ACC). Exceptional 46 power with balanced stats.
  • Perfect For: Serious beginners who want competitive super-rare bot

Token #1315 - Master Speed Leader

  • Price: 49.00 ICP
  • Faction: üëë Master (Super-Rare tier!)
  • Rating: 35/100
  • Stats: SPD 42 | PWR 34 | ACC 34 | STB 32
  • Why: Strong speed (42) in budget range! Master faction +11 SPD/STB, +8 PWR/ACC bonuses
  • Perfect For: Sprint racers, speed-focused strategies

Your First Purchase

Step-by-Step Guide

  1. Decide Your Budget

    • Ultra Budget: 16-30 ICP ‚Üí Start with Token #5100 (16 ICP) or #4525 (20 ICP super-rare)
    • Enthusiast: 40-50 ICP ‚Üí Get Token #4343 (super-rare Blackhole, best value)

  2. Understand What You're Getting

    • Check the stats - are they balanced or specialized?
    • Look at the faction bonuses (super-rare > rare > common)
    • Consider the terrain preference
    • View the thumbnail image

  3. Make the Purchase

    • Use the marketplace tool: purchase_pokedbot
    • Confirm you have enough ICP in your account
    • Bot will be transferred to your garage

  4. Initialize Your Bot

    • After purchase, initialize it for racing (free, one-time)
    • This reveals full stats and registers your racing license
    • You can't race until you initialize!

Quick Start Race Strategy

For Your First 5 Races

  1. Start with Practice Races (Scavenger class)

    • Entry fee: 0.05-0.5 ICP (Scavenger class)
    • Short distances (3-8km)
    • Lower stakes, good for learning

  2. Match Your Bot to the Race

    • MetalRoads terrain: Use any bot with good speed
    • WastelandSand: Use high stability bot (Dead, Animal factions)
    • ShortSprint (<5km): Use bot with high speed + acceleration
    • MediumHaul (5-15km): Use balanced stats bot
    • LongHaul (>15km): Use high power + stability bot

  3. Learn from Each Race

    • Watch how your stats perform
    • Note which terrain you do well on
    • Compare against other bots' stats

  4. Upgrade Strategically

    • Don't upgrade immediately - learn your bot first
    • Focus on your bot's weakest stat or double down on strengths
    • Upgrades cost ICP/parts and take 12 hours

Common Beginner Mistakes

‚ùå Don't Do This:

  1. Buying the cheapest bot possible

    • Bots under 35 rating will lose most races
    • Spend at least 16-20 ICP for decent stats

  2. Ignoring faction bonuses

    • Super-rare factions (Blackhole, Dead, Master) have huge bonuses
    • Rare factions (Bee, Food, Box, Murder) have good bonuses
    • Common factions (Game, Animal, Industrial) are affordable

  3. Racing without checking terrain

    • High stability bots dominate WastelandSand
    • High speed bots excel on MetalRoads
    • Always match your bot's strengths to the race

  4. Upgrading before racing

    • Learn how your bot performs first
    • You might upgrade the wrong stat

  5. Entering races you can't win

    • Check the competition's stats before entering
    • Don't enter Elite/SilentKlan races with a 35-rated bot

‚úÖ Do This Instead:

  1. Buy a super-rare faction bot first (like Blackhole #4343 or Master #4525)
  2. Start with Scavenger class races (easiest tier)
  3. Match terrain to your bot's strengths
  4. Race 5-10 times before upgrading
  5. Learn the community (watch other races, ask questions)

Recommended First Bot by Budget

If you have 16-20 ICP:

Buy Token #4525 - The super-rare Master!

  • Best value super-rare faction
  • Master bonuses (+14 SPD/STB, +11 PWR/ACC)
  • Will compete well in Scavenger races
  • Prestige factor

If you have 30 ICP:

Buy Token #1489 - The Dead speed demon ‚≠ê‚≠ê

  • Super-rare Dead faction
  • Fastest in budget range (45 speed)
  • 44 stability for rough terrain
  • Excellent for learning

If you have 40-50 ICP:

Buy Token #4343 - The Blackhole powerhouse ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

  • BEST SUPER-RARE VALUE
  • Highest rating (41) in budget
  • Blackhole faction (+18 PWR, +16 ACC - highest in game!)
  • Balanced 43 power and acceleration
  • Can compete in Raider class immediately

Next Steps

After you've purchased and raced your first bot:

  1. Join the Community

    • Follow race results
    • Learn from top racers
    • Share your victories!

  2. Expand Your Garage

    • Buy a second bot with different faction
    • Have options for different terrains
    • Experiment with different playstyles

  3. Start Upgrading

    • Focus on your bot's weakest stat first
    • Or double down on strengths (e.g., make fast bot even faster)
    • Track upgrade effectiveness

  4. Enter Bigger Races

    • Move from Scavenger ‚Üí Raider ‚Üí Elite
    • Higher stakes = bigger prizes
    • Build your bot's reputation

Frequently Asked Questions

üí∞ How much ICP do I need to start?

Minimum 16 ICP for a bot, plus ~1-2 ICP for your first few race entries. 20-30 ICP is recommended for a comfortable start with a super-rare faction bot and room for races and repairs.

‚ùå Can I lose ICP racing?

Yes - entry fees are not refunded if you lose. Start with cheap Scavenger Daily races (0.05 ICP entry) to learn the mechanics before risking more ICP on higher-stakes races or upgrading to higher classes.

üîã What happens if my bot's battery runs out?

You need to recharge (10 ICP, 6 hour cooldown) to restore battery and condition. Keep an eye on your battery level - it drains by 10 per race, and you can't enter races with less than 50 battery.

üîß Should I repair or recharge my bot?
  • Recharge (10 ICP): Restores +20 condition AND +10 battery. Best when battery is low.
  • Repair (5 ICP): Restores +10 condition only. Use when battery is fine but condition is dropping.

If you can afford it, recharging is usually the better value.

üí∏ Can I sell my bot later?

Yes! List it on the marketplace anytime. Bots with good race records, high ratings, and rare factions sell for more. Your bot's career stats are permanent, so building a winning record increases its value.

ü§ñ Which faction is best for beginners?

Super-Rare Factions (Master, Dead, Blackhole) - Best bonuses and prestige at reasonable prices. Once you understand the game:

  • Game/Animal/Industrial (Common tier) for budget learning
  • Bee/Food/Box/Murder (Rare tier) for specialized strategies
  • Wild/Golden/Ultimate (Ultra-rare tier) when you're ready for elite collecting

Summary

Best First Bot for Most Beginners: üëâ Token #4343 @ 44 ICP üëà

  • Super-rare Blackhole faction (only 244 exist!)
  • Highest rating (41) in affordable range
  • Blackhole has +18 Power Core (highest in game!) + +16 Acceleration
  • Balanced 43 PWR and 43 ACC stats
  • Will compete well in Scavenger and Raider classes
  • Elite prestige from day one

Runner-ups:

  • Ultra budget: Token #5100 @ 16 ICP (Food faction starter)
  • Super-rare budget: Token #4525 @ 20 ICP (Master faction prestige)
  • Speed specialist: Token #1489 @ 30 ICP (Dead faction, 45 speed)

Welcome to the wasteland, racer! Good luck on the tracks! üèÅü§ñ

guides.content:
PokedBots Racing: Complete System Guide üèÅ

Your Ultimate Guide to Dominating the Wasteland - November 29, 2025

üéØ Executive Summary

PokedBots Racing is a fully operational NFT racing platform on the Internet Computer with:

  • 10,000 unique PokedBots with diverse stats and capabilities
  • 14 faction types across 4 rarity tiers with distinct bonuses and playstyles
  • Dynamic racing system with multiple classes and terrains
  • Complete bot lifecycle: Purchase ‚Üí Initialize ‚Üí Upgrade ‚Üí Race ‚Üí Earn
  • Price range: 6 ICP (budget racers) to 88,888 ICP (elite champions)

This guide provides data-driven recommendations for getting started and maximizing your success.

üìä Market Analysis & Recommendations

Current Marketplace Snapshot

By Faction Distribution:

  • Murder (999 bots): Common tier, reliable performers
  • Game (1654 bots): Most common, all-around bots
  • Animal (1701 bots): Common tier, stable choices
  • Industrial (2009 bots): Most abundant, budget options
  • Bee (717 bots): Rare tier, specialized
  • Food (778 bots): Rare tier, balanced
  • Box (798 bots): Rare tier, compact
  • Master (640 bots): Super-rare, premium bots
  • Dead (382 bots): Super-rare, stability specialists
  • Blackhole (244 bots): Super-rare, power specialists
  • Ultimate (45 bots): Ultra-rare elite
  • Golden (27 bots): Ultra-rare elite
  • Wild (5 bots): Ultra-rare elite
  • UltimateMaster (1 bot): The rarest!

Price Tiers:

Tier Price Range Typical Rating Target Audience
Budget 6-20 ICP 15-20 Beginners, experimenting
Value 21-50 ICP 20-28 Competitive entry
Premium 51-200 ICP 28-38 Serious racers
Elite 201-1,000 ICP 38-45 Top competitors
Ultra 1,001-88,888 ICP 45-63 Collectors, whales

Note: Only 78 bots (0.8%) have ratings above 40. The top 3 bots are all Wild or UltimateMaster faction with ratings 60-63. Most bots (85%) are rated below 30.

üèÜ Recommended Starting Strategies

Strategy 1: Budget Racer (Low Risk)

Investment: 25-40 ICP total

Bot Purchase:

  • Target: Common tier bots (Murder, Game, Animal, Industrial) in 6-20 ICP range
  • Minimum rating: 18/100
  • Example: Look for budget Industrial or Animal faction bots

Racing Approach:

  • Start with Scavenger class races (0.05-0.5 ICP entry fees)
  • Enter 5-10 races to learn mechanics
  • Focus on MetalRoads terrain (most common)

Expected Costs:

  • Bot: 6-20 ICP
  • 5 race entries: 0.25-1 ICP
  • 1 recharge: 0.1 ICP
  • Optional: 1 upgrade (3 parts, ~10 ICP)
  • Total: 6.35-31.1 ICP

Pros:

  • Low financial risk
  • Learn the game mechanics cheaply
  • Multiple bots possible for diversification

Cons:

  • Lower win probability
  • Slower progression
  • May need multiple recharges

Strategy 2: Competitive Entry (Balanced)

Investment: 60-100 ICP total

Bot Purchase:

  • Target: Super-rare bots (Dead, Blackhole, Master) with 28-35 rating
  • Price range: 30-80 ICP
  • Example: Look for Dead or Blackhole faction for best value in super-rare tier

Racing Approach:

  • Start with Scavenger races to build record
  • Upgrade 1 key stat after 3-5 races (10 ICP)
  • Progress to Raider class after 3+ wins
  • Specialize in one terrain type

Expected Costs:

  • Bot: 30-50 ICP
  • 10 race entries: 0.5-5 ICP
  • 2 recharges: 0.2 ICP
  • 1-2 upgrades: 10-20 ICP (first upgrades to different stats)
  • Total: 40.7-75.2 ICP

Pros:

  • Competitive win rates
  • Room for strategic upgrades
  • Faster progression path

Cons:

  • Moderate investment required
  • Still competing against elite bots

Strategy 3: Elite Competitor (High Investment)

Investment: 200-500 ICP total

Bot Purchase:

  • Target: Ultra-rare (Ultimate, Golden) or top tier Super-rare (Blackhole)
  • Rating: 38-48
  • Price range: 99-500 ICP
  • Example: Look for Ultra-rare Ultimate or Golden faction bots for competitive advantage

Racing Approach:

  • Enter Raider/Elite class races immediately
  • Multiple strategic upgrades (30-40 ICP)
  • Specialize bot for specific race types
  • Build reputation quickly

Expected Costs:

  • Bot: 99-500 ICP
  • 15 Elite race entries: 7.5-75 ICP
  • 3-5 recharges: 0.3-0.5 ICP
  • 3-4 upgrades: 37.5-82.5 ICP (progressive costs: 10+17.5+27.5+40)
  • Total: 144.3-658 ICP

Pros:

  • Highest win probability
  • Access to biggest prize pools
  • Quick progression to SilentKlan races
  • Competitive advantage from day 1

Cons:

  • Significant upfront investment
  • Higher race entry fees
  • Pressure to perform

üéØ Faction-Specific Recommendations

Murder (999 bots - Rare)

Bonuses: +3 SPD/ACC/STB, +1 PWR

Best For:

  • Beginners (common, good availability)
  • Medium-distance races (10-20km)
  • MetalRoads terrain
  • Combat-focused strategy

Recommended Purchase:

  • Budget: 6-10 ICP, 18-22 rating
  • Value: 20-35 ICP, 22-28 rating

Upgrade Priority:

  1. Speed (Velocity) - Leverage +3 bonus
  2. Acceleration (Thruster) - Improve +3 bonus
  3. Stability (Gyro) - Cover +3 bonus

Dead (382 bots - Super-Rare)

Bonuses: +10 STB, +9 PWR, +7 SPD/ACC

Best For:

  • WastelandSand terrain specialists
  • Rough terrain races
  • Stability and endurance-focused
  • Undead resilience

Recommended Purchase:

  • Budget: 21 ICP, 24 rating
  • Value: 30-100 ICP, 28-35 rating

Upgrade Priority:

  1. Speed (Velocity) - Compensate with +7 bonus
  2. Power (PowerCore) - Maximize +9 bonus
  3. Acceleration (Thruster) - Complement +7 bonus

Pro Tip: Dead bots excel in rough terrain with their strong +10 stability bonus!

Game (1654 bots - Common)

Bonuses: +1 SPD/ACC, +0 PWR/STB

Best For:

  • Sprint races (<10km)
  • MetalRoads terrain
  • Fast starts and positioning
  • WastelandSand specialist

Recommended Purchase:

  • Value: 25-45 ICP, 22-30 rating

Upgrade Priority:

  1. Speed (Velocity) - Minimal +1 bonus
  2. Acceleration (Thruster) - Minimal +1 bonus
  3. Power (PowerCore) - Handle longer races

Pro Tip: Game bots get +8% terrain bonus on WastelandSand!

Master (640 bots - Super-Rare)

Bonuses: +11 SPD/STB, +8 PWR/ACC

Best For:

  • Serious competitors
  • All race types
  • Strong all-around performance
  • Status symbol

Recommended Purchase:

  • Premium: 1,800-4,000 ICP, 42-46 rating
  • Elite: 9,000+ ICP, 46-50 rating

Upgrade Priority:

  1. Stability (Gyro) - Round out +10 bonus
  2. Acceleration (Thruster) - Maximize +10 bonus
  3. Speed (Velocity) - Already strong +14, make dominant

Investment Note: Master bots are super-rare with exceptional +14/+10 bonuses.

Ultra-Rare Tier (Ultimate, Golden, Wild, UltimateMaster)

Bonuses:

  • Ultimate: +5 SPD/PWR, +3 ACC/STB (45 bots)
  • Golden: +3 to all stats (27 bots)
  • Wild: +3 to all stats (5 bots)
  • UltimateMaster: +5 to all stats (1 bot - the rarest!)

Best For:

  • Collectors
  • Elite competition
  • Maximum performance
  • Long-term investment

Recommended Purchase:

  • Value: 44-99 ICP, 35-38 rating (if available)
  • Premium: 555-3,000 ICP, 38-42 rating
  • Elite: 4,500+ ICP, 42-50 rating

Upgrade Priority:

  1. Any weak stat (balanced bonuses)
  2. Double down on strengths
  3. Terrain-specific optimization

Investment Note: Ultra-rare tier represents the top 78 bots out of 10,000. UltimateMaster is 1-of-1!

IMPORTANT - Stat Distribution Reality:

  • Average bot rating: 20.9/100 (most bots are 15-30 range)
  • 6.8% of bots rated above 30 (679 bots)
  • Only 0.6% of bots rated above 40 (59 bots - all ultra-rares!)
  • Only 3 bots rated above 50 (all Wild or UltimateMaster)
  • Top 3 bots ever: UltimateMaster #8221 (69.0), Wild #2177 (65.8), Wild #1778 (62.5)
  • Ultra-rare dominance: All 78 ultra-rare bots in top 100, rating range 28-66
  • Rarity = Performance: Ultra-rare faction bonuses (+8 to +25) create clear tier separation

Individual stats range: 10-70 per stat (speed, power, acceleration, stability)

üèÅ Race Strategy Guide

Understanding Race Classes

Scavenger Class (0-2 wins)

  • Events Available: Daily Sprint, Weekly League
  • Entry Fees: 0.05-0.5 ICP depending on event (Daily/Weekly/Monthly)
  • Prize Pools: 0.15-11 ICP (based on entries + platform bonus)
  • Competition: Beginner bots
  • Strategy: Learn mechanics, build win record
  • Recommended: All new racers start here

Raider Class (3-9 wins)

  • Events Available: Daily Sprint, Weekly League
  • Entry Fees: 0.1-1 ICP depending on event (Daily/Weekly/Monthly)
  • Prize Pools: 0.15-11 ICP (based on entries + platform bonus)
  • Competition: Upgraded mid-tier bots
  • Strategy: Specialized builds, terrain matching
  • Recommended: After 3 wins and 1-2 upgrades

Elite Class (10+ wins)

  • Events Available: Daily Sprint, Weekly League, Monthly Cup
  • Entry Fees: 0.25-2.5 ICP depending on event (Daily/Weekly/Monthly)
  • Prize Pools: 0.15-37 ICP (based on entries + platform bonus)
  • Competition: Highly upgraded premium bots
  • Strategy: Min-maxed builds, perfect terrain/distance matching
  • Recommended: Multiple upgrades, 30+ rating

SilentKlan (10+ wins, invite only)

  • Events Available: Weekly League, Monthly Cup
  • Entry Fees: 0.5-5 ICP depending on event (Weekly/Monthly only)
  • Prize Pools: 2.2-37 ICP (based on entries + platform bonus)
  • Competition: Best of the best (Ultra-rare/Super-rare only)
  • Strategy: Elite Ultra-rare/Master bots, full upgrades
  • Recommended: Top 5% performers only

Terrain Optimization

MetalRoads (Most Common)

  • Favors: Speed + Acceleration
  • Best Factions: Game, Murder, Ultimate
  • Upgrade Focus: Velocity, Thruster
  • Race Length: Usually MediumHaul (10-20km)

WastelandSand (Rough Terrain)

  • Favors: Stability + Power
  • Best Factions: Dead, Blackhole, Master

üîß Upgrade Strategy Matrix

Understanding the Upgrade System

PokedBots Racing uses a progressive cost, scrap-based upgrade system with three paths to upgrading:

Path 1: Direct ICP Purchase (Current)

  • 10 ICP ‚Üí 3 specific parts (e.g., Speed Chips for Velocity upgrades)
  • Instant materials, no waiting
  • Simple and predictable

Path 2: Scrap NFTs (Planned)

  • Purchase NFTs from any EXT collection marketplace
  • Scrap them for parts based on rarity and value
  • Example: 100 ICP ICPunk ‚Üí ~15 Universal Parts (60 ICP equivalent)
  • Potential 30-50% savings for skilled scrappers

Path 3: Hybrid (Planned)

  • Combine scrap parts + ICP for discounts
  • Example: 2 parts + 10 ICP = upgrade (50% discount)

Progressive Cost Curve

Each successive upgrade to the same stat costs more parts:

Upgrade #1:  3 parts ‚Üí +1-3 to stat (~10 ICP)
Upgrade #2:  5 parts ‚Üí +1-2 to stat (~17.5 ICP)
Upgrade #3:  8 parts ‚Üí +1-2 to stat (~27.5 ICP)
Upgrade #4: 12 parts ‚Üí +0-1 to stat (~40 ICP)
Upgrade #5: 18 parts ‚Üí +0-1 to stat (~60 ICP)
Upgrade #6: 25 parts ‚Üí +0-1 to stat (~85 ICP)

Why This Matters:

  • First upgrade is affordable (10 ICP)
  • Early upgrades give best returns (+1-3 stat points)
  • Later upgrades have diminishing returns (+0-1 stat points)
  • Creates natural stat caps around 70-75
  • Preserves value of naturally high-stat bots

When to Upgrade

After 3 Races:

  • Identify your bot's weakest stat
  • First upgrade to any stat: 3 parts (~10 ICP)
  • Best bang for buck: +1-3 stat points

After 10 Races:

  • Second upgrade to same stat: 5 parts (~17.5 ICP)
  • OR first upgrade to different stat: 3 parts (~10 ICP)
  • Consider terrain specialization

After 20 Races:

  • Third upgrade to primary stat: 8 parts (~27.5 ICP)
  • OR spread upgrades across multiple stats
  • Focus on your preferred race type

After 50 Races:

  • Fourth+ upgrades get expensive (12+ parts)
  • Consider if 40-60 ICP for +0-1 is worth it
  • May be better to buy a second bot or diversify stats

Upgrade Priority by Bot Type

Balanced Bot (all stats 15-25):

  1. First upgrade (3 parts): Speed (biggest impact on race times)
  2. Second upgrade (3 parts): Acceleration (different stat = still cheap!)
  3. Third upgrade (3 parts): Power OR Stability
  4. Fourth upgrade (5 parts): Second Speed upgrade (now more expensive)
  • Strategy: Spread early upgrades across stats to keep costs low

Speed Specialist (Speed 35+):

  1. First (3 parts): Acceleration (complement strength, cheap)
  2. Second (3 parts): Stability (cover weakness, still cheap)
  3. Third (5 parts): Second Speed upgrade (already at 35+, so 2nd upgrade)
  4. Fourth (3 parts): Power (new stat, back to cheap cost)
  • Strategy: Avoid pushing already-high stats early (expensive!)

Endurance Specialist (Power 35+):

  1. First (3 parts): Stability (complement strength)
  2. Second (3 parts): Speed (improve race times)
  3. Third (5 parts): Second Power upgrade (maximize strength)
  4. Fourth (3 parts): Acceleration (round out build)
  • Strategy: Build complementary stats first, then double down

Low-Rated Bot (12-18):

  1. First (3 parts): Weakest stat (bring to 15-20)
  2. Second (3 parts): Second weakest stat (balance)
  3. Third (3 parts): Third stat (all upgrades still cheap!)
  4. Fourth (5-8 parts): Decision time - worth it or buy better bot?
  • Strategy: Low-stat bots benefit most from spreading cheap upgrades

When NOT to Upgrade

  • Target: 45-50% win rate in Elite class
  • Expected outcome: +30-50 ICP/month racing profit + bot value appreciation

Why This Economy Works for Players

Platform bonuses subsidize your learning:

  • Scavenger/Raider classes get extra prize money (0.5-2 ICP per race)
  • You can break even while mastering the game
  • No need to be a pro from day one

Class scaling creates natural progression:

  • Start cheap in Scavenger (0.05 ICP races)
  • Graduate to Raider when ready (0.1-0.4 ICP races)
  • Compete for big prizes in Elite/SilentKlan (1-5 ICP races)
  • Always race at stakes matching your skill level

Affordable upgrades accelerate your growth:

  • First upgrade: just 10 ICP
  • 3 upgrades for competitive bot: 20-30 ICP total
  • No pay-to-win, just pay-to-compete at your tier

NFT value retention protects your investment:

  • Upgraded bots sell for 2-4x purchase price
  • Win record adds value
  • Ultra-rare/Super-rare hold value long-term
  • You can exit profitably even if racing isn't for you

Self-sustaining economy means longevity:

  • Elite/SilentKlan races run without platform subsidies
  • Prize pools grow with entry fees
  • More players = bigger races = better prizes
  • Platform economics ensure it survives and thrives

The Economic Reality

PokedBots Racing is a skill-based earning game where:

  • Beginners can break even while learning (0-6 ICP profit in first month)
  • Competitive players earn steady income (15-40 ICP/month in Raider/Elite)
  • Champions dominate premium races (50+ ICP/month in SilentKlan)
  • Bot trading amplifies returns (sell upgraded bots for 2-4x purchase price)
  • Total addressable market: Players who enjoy competitive racing AND want real earnings

‚ö†Ô∏è Common Mistakes to Avoid

1. Buying Without Research

Mistake: Buying first bot you see
Solution: Compare 10-20 bots, calculate value scores

2. Ignoring Faction Bonuses

Mistake: Only looking at base rating
Solution: Factor in faction bonuses: +25 UltimateMaster, +11/+8 Master, +10/+9/+7 Dead, +18 Blackhole Power, etc.

3. Over-Racing Without Maintenance

Mistake: Racing with <70 condition or <50 battery
Solution: Recharge before critical thresholds

4. Inefficient Upgrade Spending

Mistake: Pushing one stat to 70+ early (costs 40-85 ICP for +0-1)
Solution: Spread first upgrades across multiple stats (3 parts each = great value)

Example - Bad:

  • 6 upgrades to Speed: 3+5+8+12+18+25 = 71 parts (237.5 ICP!) ‚Üí +8-12 total

Example - Good:

  • 1 upgrade each to 4 stats: 3+3+3+3 = 12 parts (40 ICP) ‚Üí +8-12 total
  • Same total gain, over 5x cheaper!

5. Wrong Race Class

Mistake: Entering Elite races with 55-rated bot
Solution: Progress through classes, build win record

6. Ignoring Terrain

Mistake: Dead bot (stability specialist) in MetalRoads sprint races
Solution: Match bot strengths to race conditions

7. Panic Selling

Mistake: Selling after a few losses
Solution: Give bots 20+ races to prove themselves

8. Upgrade During Events

Mistake: Upgrading when big race scheduled tomorrow
Solution: Plan around calendar (12-hour lockout)

üéì Recommended Learning Path

Phase 1: Observation (Week 1)

  • Browse marketplace daily
  • Study faction distributions
  • Watch race results (when available)
  • Read all guides
  • Don't buy yet

Phase 2: Budget Entry (Week 2)

  • Purchase 6-21 ICP bot
  • Enter 10 Scavenger races (auto-promote after 3 wins)
  • Track performance metrics
  • Learn terrain/distance preferences
  • Investment: 16-31 ICP (bot + 1 upgrade + entry fees)

Phase 3: Competitive Play (Weeks 3-8)

  • Continue in Raider class (auto-promoted from Scavenger)
  • Add 1-2 more upgrades (10-20 ICP each)
  • Build toward 10 total wins for Elite promotion
  • Consider upgrading to 30 ICP bot if profitable
  • Investment: 20-50 ICP (upgrades + entry fees)

Phase 4: Elite Competition (Month 2+)

  • Purchase premium bot (Ultra-rare/Super-rare tier)
  • Multiple upgrades
  • Elite/SilentKlan races
  • Portfolio management
  • Investment: 150-350 ICP

üìû Final Recommendations Summary

Best Overall Starting Strategy

Rare tier bot (20-40 ICP, 20-26 rating)

  • Excellent balance of price and performance
  • Moderate faction bonuses (Murder +3 SPD/ACC/STB, Bee +6 ACC, Food +6 PWR)
  • Competitive in Scavenger and Raider classes
  • Upgrade potential for long-term use

Best Budget Strategy

Common tier bot (5-15 ICP, 16-20 rating)

  • Lowest price for entry-level racing
  • Perfect learning bot for first 10 races
  • Minimal faction bonuses (+0-1 per stat)
  • Factions: Industrial, Animal, Game
  • Sell after promotion to invest in better bot

Best Value Investment

Super-rare tier (50-150 ICP, 28-36 rating)

  • Super-rare factions (Dead, Blackhole, Master)
  • Strong bonuses (+10 STB Dead, +18 PWR Blackhole, +11 SPD/STB Master)
  • Competitive in Elite races after 10 wins
  • Strong resale value with upgrade history

Best Elite Purchase

Ultra-rare tier (5,000+ ICP, 35-69 rating)

  • Ultra-rare factions (Ultimate, Golden, Wild, UltimateMaster)
  • Dominant bonuses (+8-12 Ultimate, +14-18 Golden, +18-24 Wild, +25 UltimateMaster)
  • All 78 ultra-rares rank in top 100
  • Elite/SilentKlan domination after 10 wins
  • Investment-grade NFTs with long-term value

üéÆ Conclusion

PokedBots Racing offers deep strategic gameplay with multiple viable paths to success. Whether you're a budget racer learning the ropes with a 10 ICP Industrial bot or an elite competitor with a fully upgraded Ultra-rare champion, the system rewards smart decision-making, strategic planning, and consistent performance.

Key Success Factors:

  1. Research before buying - Use value scores
  2. Match bot to races - Terrain and distance matter
  3. Maintain your fleet - Recharge before battery hits 40
  4. Upgrade strategically - Specialize, don't generalize
  5. Progress through classes - Build reputation gradually
  6. Track performance - Learn from each race
  7. Manage your budget - Plan for maintenance costs

Remember: Rarity now equals performance with the new balanced stat system. Ultra-rares dominate the top 100 with faction bonuses ranging from +8 to +25. However, a well-upgraded 65 ICP Dead bot (Super-rare) can still compete in Elite class with strategic upgrades and terrain advantages.

üìö Additional Resources

  • Beginner's Racing Guide - First-time racer walkthrough
  • MCP Tools Guide - Complete tool reference
  • Blackhole Bots for Sale - Super-rare power specialists
  • DeadBot Shopping Guide - Super-rare stability specialists
  • Elite Faction Showcase - Ultra-rare premium bot analysis

Good luck in the wasteland, racer! May your battery stay charged and your condition stay high. ‚ö°üèÅ

For questions, system updates, or community support, check the PokedBots Racing Discord and official documentation.

Last Updated: November 29, 2025

  • Super-rare prestige at budget prices
  • Strong bonuses elevate lower base stats through racing
  • Significant upgrade potential
  • Specialized strategies for power-focused racing

üèÅ Blackhole Race Strategy

Sprint Races (< 5km):

Best: #3033 (44 SPD, balanced)
Budget: #4343 (35 SPD, excellent power)

Medium Haul (5-15km):

Best: #3033 (balanced 44/45/43/43)
Power: #4343 (46 PWR for endurance)

Long Endurance (> 15km):

Best: #4343 (46 PWR specialist, leverage +18 Power Core bonus)
Strategy: High power maintains speed over distance

Technical/MetalRoads:

Best: #3033 or #8233 (43 ACC on both)
Why: +16 Acceleration bonus dominates turns and obstacles

üìù Important Notes

‚úÖ All stats shown include Blackhole faction bonuses (+18 PWR, +16 ACC, +13 SPD/STB)
‚úÖ All bots are uninitialized - use garage_initialize_pokedbot after purchase
‚úÖ Blackhole bonus applies to every race - no situational limitations
‚úÖ Super-Rare Status - Only 244 Blackhole bots exist (2.44% of collection)
‚úÖ Power Specialists - Highest Power Core bonus in the game (+18)
‚úÖ Prices current as of November 29, 2025

üéÅ Quick Decision Guide

If you have 50 ICP or less:
‚Üí Buy #4343 @ 44 ICP (best value super-rare Blackhole!)

If you have 100 ICP:
‚Üí Buy #8233 @ 99 ICP (acceleration specialist, perfect for technical courses)

If you want premium balance:
‚Üí Buy #3033 @ 555 ICP (44 SPD + 45 STB balanced premium)

Strategy Tips:

  • Blackhole excels in endurance races (15km+) with +18 Power Core
  • Use #8233's 47 acceleration on MetalRoads and technical courses
  • Upgrade through racing to maximize Blackhole's strong bonuses
  • Power-focused strategies work best with this faction

Ready to harness the power of the void? Get your Blackhole bot today! ‚ö´‚ú®

metadata.title: MCP Tools Guide
metadata.description: Complete reference for the Model Context Protocol tools and AI agent integration

guides.content:
PokedBots Racing MCP Tools Guide ü§ñüèÅ

Complete Guide to Using the Model Context Protocol Server - November 16, 2025

Table of Contents

  1. What is This?
  2. Getting Started
  3. Marketplace Tools
  4. Garage Tools
  5. Racing Tools
  6. Common Workflows
  7. Tips & Tricks
  8. Troubleshooting

What is This?

PokedBots Racing is an NFT racing game built on the Internet Computer where you can:

  • Buy unique PokedBot NFTs from the marketplace
  • Store them in your personal garage
  • Enter them in wasteland races
  • Upgrade, repair, and maintain your bots
  • Compete for prizes and build your bot's reputation

The MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server lets you interact with the game using natural language through AI assistants. Instead of clicking through a website, you can ask questions like:

  • "Show me WildBots for sale under 50 ICP"
  • "List my bots in the garage"
  • "Enter bot #4247 in the next race"

Getting Started

Prerequisites

  1. Internet Computer Account - You need ICP tokens to buy bots and enter races
  2. MCP-Compatible AI Client - Like Claude Desktop or other MCP-enabled tools
  3. PokedBots NFTs - Buy from the marketplace or own existing bots

First Steps

  1. Browse the Marketplace - See what bots are available
  2. Purchase Your First Bot - Start with something affordable (20-50 ICP)
  3. Initialize Your Bot - Register it for racing (free, one-time)
  4. Enter Your First Race - Try a Scavenger class race to learn

Marketplace Tools

üè™ browse_pokedbots

What it does: Search and filter bots for sale on the marketplace

Common Uses:

Show me all WildBots for sale
Find BattleBots under 30 ICP with 60+ rating
Show the highest-rated GodClass bots
List Master faction bots sorted by price

Filters Available:

  • faction - Filter by: BattleBot, EntertainmentBot, WildBot, GodClass, Master
  • minRating - Minimum overall rating (30-100)
  • maxPrice - Maximum price in ICP
  • minWins - Minimum race wins
  • minWinRate - Minimum win percentage
  • sortBy - Sort by: price, rating, winRate, wins
  • sortDesc - Sort descending (highest first)

Example Output:

ü§ñ Token #1417
   üí∞ Price: 30.00 ICP
   ‚ö° Base: 63/100 | üèÜ WildBot
   üìä Stats: SPD 64 | PWR 62 | ACC 61 | STB 65
   üèÅ Record: No races yet
   üéØ Prefers: MetalRoads terrain, MediumHaul
   üñºÔ∏è  Image: [thumbnail URL]

Pro Tips:

  • Use minRating=60 to filter out low-quality bots
  • Combine maxPrice and minRating for value hunting
  • sortBy=rating with sortDesc=true shows the best first
  • Check the image thumbnail to see what your bot looks like!

üí∞ purchase_pokedbot

What it does: Buy a bot from the marketplace and send it to your garage

How to Use:

Purchase bot #1417
Buy token 4247

What Happens:

  1. System checks you have enough ICP (price + fees)
  2. Payment is transferred to the seller
  3. Bot NFT is transferred from seller's garage to your garage subaccount
  4. Bot is automatically unlisted from marketplace
  5. Bot is now yours to initialize and race!

Important:

  • Fees: Transaction includes small network fees (~0.0001 ICP)
  • No Refunds: Sales are final - choose carefully!
  • Atomic Transfer: Payment and NFT transfer happen simultaneously
  • Not Race-Ready: Must initialize bot after purchase (see Garage Tools)

üö´ list_pokedbot

What it does: Put one of your bots up for sale on the marketplace

How to Use:

List bot #1417 for 50 ICP
Sell token 4247 for 100 ICP

What Happens:

  1. Bot is marked as "for sale" at your specified price
  2. Listed on the marketplace for anyone to browse
  3. Bot stays in your garage until someone purchases it
  4. You cannot race it while it's listed

Important:

  • Minimum Price: 0.01 ICP
  • Still Yours: Bot remains in your garage until sold
  • Cannot Race: Listed bots are locked from racing
  • Can Unlist: Use unlist_pokedbot to remove listing anytime

üì§ unlist_pokedbot

What it does: Remove your bot from the marketplace

How to Use:

Unlist bot #1417
Remove token 4247 from marketplace

What Happens:

  1. Bot is removed from marketplace listings
  2. "For sale" status is cleared
  3. Bot is now available for racing again

üéÅ transfer_pokedbot

What it does: Gift or transfer a bot to another user's garage

How to Use:

Transfer bot #1417 to [account_id]
Send token 4247 to [account_id]

What Happens:

  1. Bot is removed from your garage
  2. Bot is sent to recipient's garage subaccount
  3. Transfer is permanent - no undo!

Important:

  • No Payment: This is a gift/transfer, not a sale
  • Verify Account: Double-check the recipient account ID
  • Permanent: Cannot be reversed
  • Cannot Transfer Listed Bots: Must unlist first

Garage Tools

Your garage is your personal collection of PokedBots. Think of it as your team headquarters.

üöó list_my_pokedbots

What it does: Show all bots you own with their stats and status

How to Use:

Show my bots
List my garage
What bots do I own?

Example Output:

ü§ñ Token #1417 | WildBot
   üìä Rating: 63/100
   ‚ö° Stats: SPD 64 | PWR 62 | ACC 61 | STB 65
   üîã Condition: 100 | Battery: 100
   üèÅ Record: 5 races, 2 wins (40% win rate)
   ‚úÖ Status: Ready to race
   üñºÔ∏è  Image: [thumbnail URL]

Status Indicators:

  • ‚úÖ Ready to race - Good to go!
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è Needs recharge - Battery < 50 or Condition < 70
  • üîÑ Upgrading - Currently in upgrade session
  • üè™ Listed on marketplace - For sale, cannot race

üîß get_robot_details

What it does: Get comprehensive details about a specific bot

How to Use:

Show details for bot #1417
Get info on token 4247

What You'll See:

  • Full stats breakdown (Speed, Power, Acceleration, Stability)
  • Current condition and battery levels
  • Complete race history with results
  • Upgrade status and cooldown timers
  • Faction bonuses applied
  • Terrain preferences

When to Use:

  • Before entering a race (check condition/battery)
  • After a race (see updated stats)
  • When planning upgrades
  • To review racing history

üéÆ initialize_pokedbot

What it does: Register your bot for racing (one-time, required before first race)

How to Use:

Initialize bot #1417
Register token 4247 for racing
Get my bot ready to race

What Happens:

  1. Bot's NFT traits are analyzed
  2. Racing stats are calculated based on traits + faction bonuses
  3. Bot receives official wasteland racing license
  4. Bot is now eligible to enter races

Important:

  • Free: No cost, one-time only
  • Required: Must initialize before entering any races
  • Cannot Reverse: Permanent registration
  • Reveals Stats: This is when you see final racing stats

Why It's Needed: The initialization process reads your NFT's traits (body parts, colors, special attributes) and converts them into racing stats with faction bonuses applied. It's like taking your bot to the DMV!

üîÑ recharge_robot

What it does: Restore condition and battery to get back to racing

Cost: 10 ICP + 0.0001 ICP network fee
Restores:

  • +20 Condition
  • +10 Battery

Cooldown: 6 hours (cannot recharge same bot twice in 6 hours)

How to Use:

Recharge bot #1417
Restore token 4247

When to Use:

  • Battery is below 50 (warning threshold)
  • Condition is below 70 (warning threshold)
  • Before important races you can't afford to lose
  • When you want to race multiple times quickly

Pro Tips:

  • Recharge before battery hits 40 (races drain 10 battery each)
  • Condition affects performance - keep it above 70
  • Plan recharges around race schedules (6-hour cooldown)

üî® repair_robot

What it does: Restore condition (cheaper than recharge, no battery boost)

Cost: 5 ICP + 0.0001 ICP network fee
Restores:

  • +10 Condition (only)

Cooldown: 3 hours

How to Use:

Repair bot #1417
Fix token 4247

When to Use:

  • Condition is low but battery is fine
  • Budget racing (cheaper than recharge)
  • Not racing immediately (12-hour cooldown is okay)

Repair vs Recharge:

Action Cost Condition Battery Cooldown
Repair 5 ICP +10 0 3 hours
Recharge 10 ICP +20 +10 6 hours

‚¨ÜÔ∏è upgrade_robot

What it does: Permanently improve one of your bot's stats

Cost: 20 ICP + 0.0001 ICP network fee
Duration: 12 hours (upgrade session)
Boost: Adds points to chosen stat

Upgrade Types:

  • Velocity - Increases Speed
  • PowerCore - Increases Power Core
  • Thruster - Increases Acceleration
  • Gyro - Increases Stability

How to Use:

Upgrade bot #1417 with Velocity
Add PowerCore upgrade to token 4247
Improve acceleration on my bot

What Happens:

  1. You pay 20 ICP
  2. Bot enters 12-hour upgrade session (cannot race during this time)
  3. After 12 hours, stat is permanently increased
  4. Bot is ready to race with improved stats

Strategy Tips:

  • Speed Upgrade (Velocity): For sprint races and MetalRoads
  • Power Upgrade (PowerCore): For long endurance races
  • Acceleration Upgrade (Thruster): For race starts and obstacle courses
  • Stability Upgrade (Gyro): For WastelandSand and rough terrain

Planning Upgrades:

  • Check your bot's weakest stat first
  • Or double down on strengths (make fast bots even faster)
  • Don't upgrade during race events (12-hour lockout)
  • Upgrades stack - you can upgrade multiple times

Racing Tools

üèÅ list_races

What it does: Browse upcoming races with filters

How to Use:

Show all upcoming races
Find Scavenger class races
Show Elite races on WastelandSand
List races with prize pools over 50 ICP

Filters Available:

  • race_class - Scavenger, Raider, Elite, SilentKlan
  • terrain - MetalRoads, WastelandSand, ScrapHeaps
  • status - open, full, closed
  • min_distance / max_distance - Race distance in km
  • has_spots - true (only races with open spots)
  • token_index - Your bot's token (shows only eligible races)
  • sortBy - prize_pool, start_time, entry_fee, distance

Example Output:

üèÅ Race #42 - Scavenger Class
   üèÜ Prize Pool: 10.5 ICP (7 entries)
   üí∞ Entry Fee: 0.15 ICP
   üìè Distance: 8.2 km (MediumHaul)
   üåç Terrain: MetalRoads
   üë• Spots: 7/12 filled
   ‚è∞ Starts: 2 hours from now
   üìä Entry Status: OPEN

Race Classes:

  • Scavenger - Entry-level races, lowest fees, beginner-friendly
  • Raider - Mid-tier races, moderate fees and prizes
  • Elite - High-stakes races, large prize pools, tough competition
  • SilentKlan - Ultra-exclusive races, requires 10+ race wins

Pro Tips:

  • Use token_index filter to see only races your bot qualifies for
  • sortBy=prize_pool with sortDesc=true shows biggest prizes first
  • Check has_spots=true to avoid full races
  • Look at entry fee vs prize pool for value assessment

üéüÔ∏è enter_race

What it does: Enter your bot in a specific race

How to Use:

Enter bot #1417 in race 42
Join race 55 with token 4247

Requirements:

  • Bot must be initialized
  • Condition ‚â• 70
  • Battery ‚â• 50
  • Enough ICP for entry fee
  • Bot matches race class requirements
  • Race spots still available

What Happens:

  1. Entry fee is paid (ICRC-2 approval + transfer)
  2. Bot is registered for the race
  3. Battery is reduced by 10 (race energy cost)
  4. Bot is locked until race completes

Entry Fee Structure:

  • Scavenger: 0.05-0.5 ICP (Daily: 0.05, Weekly: 0.2, Monthly: 0.5)
  • Raider: 0.1-1 ICP (Daily: 0.1, Weekly: 0.4, Monthly: 1.0)
  • Elite: 0.25-2.5 ICP (Daily: 0.25, Weekly: 1.0, Monthly: 2.5)
  • SilentKlan: 0.5-5 ICP (Daily: 0.5, Weekly: 2.0, Monthly: 5.0)

What Affects Your Performance:

  • Your bot's stats (Speed, Power, Acceleration, Stability)
  • Terrain match (MetalRoads vs WastelandSand vs ScrapHeaps)
  • Distance type (ShortSprint vs MediumHaul vs LongTrek)
  • Current condition (lower = worse performance)
  • Faction bonuses (always active)

After Race:

  • Winners split prize pool
  • All bots gain experience
  • Stats are updated in race history
  • Battery is depleted (need to recharge for next race)

üíé sponsor_race

What it does: Add ICP to a race's prize pool (optional, for supporters)

How to Use:

Sponsor race 42 with 5 ICP
Add 10 ICP to race 55 prize pool with message "Good luck racers!"

What Happens:

  1. Your ICP is added to the race prize pool
  2. Your sponsorship is publicly displayed
  3. Optional message appears on race listing
  4. Winners receive larger prizes

Why Sponsor:

  • Support the racing community
  • Promote your garage/brand
  • Encourage participation in races
  • Build reputation as a supporter

Requirements:

  • Minimum: 0.1 ICP
  • Race Status: Must be Upcoming (not completed)
  • Message: Optional, max 100 characters

Common Workflows

üéØ Workflow 1: Buying Your First Bot

  1. Browse the marketplace:

    Show me bots under 30 ICP with 60+ rating

  2. Review options and pick one:

    Show details for bot #1417

  3. Purchase:

    Purchase bot #1417

  4. Check your garage:

    Show my bots

  5. Initialize for racing:

    Initialize bot #1417

  6. You're ready to race!

üèÅ Workflow 2: Entering Your First Race

  1. Check bot status:

    Show details for bot #1417

  2. Find suitable races:

    Show Scavenger races with my bot #1417

  3. Review race details: Look for:

    • Entry fee you can afford
    • Terrain matching your bot's preference
    • Distance appropriate for your stats

  4. Enter the race:

    Enter bot #1417 in race 42

  5. Wait for results:

    • Race will complete at scheduled time
    • Check bot details to see updated race history

üîß Workflow 3: Maintaining Your Bot

Before a race:

Show details for bot #1417

Check:

  • Condition ‚â• 70? ‚úÖ
  • Battery ‚â• 50? ‚úÖ

If low:

Recharge bot #1417

After multiple races:

Show my bot's race history

Review performance and consider upgrades

Planning an upgrade:

Upgrade bot #1417 with Velocity

Wait 12 hours, then race with improved speed!

üíº Workflow 4: Trading Bots

Selling a bot:

  1. Make sure bot is in garage (not racing or upgrading)
  2. List it: 
    List bot #1417 for 50 ICP
  3. Bot stays in your garage but appears on marketplace
  4. Wait for someone to purchase (payment + transfer happens automatically)

Changing price (need to relist):

  1. Remove listing: 
    Unlist bot #1417
  2. List at new price: 
    List bot #1417 for 40 ICP
  3. Bot remains in your garage throughout

Gifting a bot:

Transfer bot #1417 to [recipient_account_id]

Tips & Tricks

üí° Marketplace Shopping

Finding Value:

  • Look for bots with ratings 10-15 points higher than their price tier
  • Example: 65-rated bot for 30 ICP is better value than 60-rated for 40 ICP
  • Use the formula: rating √∑ price = value score (higher is better)

Faction Strategy:

  • BattleBot (38%): Most common, reliable, good starter
  • WildBot (28%): Stability masters, great for rough terrain
  • EntertainmentBot (24%): Speed/acceleration, fun for sprints
  • Master (7%): Rare, +12 SPD/PWR bonuses, competitive edge
  • GodClass (3%): Rarest, +15 all stats, ultimate prestige

Stat Priorities by Race Type:

  • Sprint (<5km): Speed + Acceleration
  • Medium (5-15km): Balanced stats
  • Endurance (>15km): Power + Stability
  • Rough terrain: Stability + Acceleration

üèÅ Racing Strategy

Race Class Progression:

  1. Start with Scavenger races (low entry, learn mechanics)
  2. Move to Raider once you have 3-5 wins
  3. Try Elite when you have upgraded bots
  4. Unlock SilentKlan after 10 total wins

Terrain Matching:

  • MetalRoads ‚Üí BattleBot or high-speed bots
  • WastelandSand ‚Üí WildBot or high-stability bots
  • ScrapHeaps ‚Üí Balanced bots with good acceleration

Battery Management:

  • Each race drains 10 battery
  • Can race 5 times before needing recharge (starting from 100)
  • Recharge costs 10 ICP but restores 20 condition too
  • Plan race schedules around 6-hour recharge cooldown

üí∞ Budget Management

Costs to Consider:

  • Bot purchase: 6-599 ICP (budget 20-50 ICP for starters)
  • Race entry fees: 0.05-5 ICP depending on class and event type
  • Recharges: 10 ICP per recharge (needed every ~5 races)
  • Repairs: 5 ICP (cheaper than recharge if battery is fine)
  • Upgrades: 20 ICP per upgrade (permanent improvement)

Budget Racing (Low Cost):

  • Buy bot: 20-30 ICP
  • Enter Scavenger races: 0.5-1.5 ICP
  • Repair instead of recharge: 5 ICP
  • Race 3-5 times before investing in upgrades

Competitive Racing (Moderate Cost):

  • Buy bot: 50-100 ICP
  • Enter Raider races: 2-10 ICP
  • Recharge regularly: 10 ICP
  • Upgrade 2-3 stats: 40-60 ICP total

üéÆ Advanced Tactics

Specialization:

  • Pick a terrain and optimize for it
  • Example: WastelandSand specialist with WildBot + Stability upgrades
  • Dominate one race type rather than being mediocre at all

Portfolio Strategy:

  • Own 2-3 bots with different specializations
  • Sprint specialist (high Speed/Acceleration)
  • Endurance specialist (high Power/Stability)
  • All-rounder (balanced stats)

Upgrade Strategy:

  • Fix Weaknesses: Bring low stats up to competitive levels
  • Double Down: Make strong stats even stronger
  • Terrain-Specific: Upgrade Stability for rough terrain bots

Troubleshooting

‚ùå "Cannot enter race - condition too low"

Problem: Bot condition is below 70
Solution: Recharge (10 ICP) or Repair (5 ICP) your bot

‚ùå "Cannot enter race - battery too low"

Problem: Bot battery is below 50
Solution: Recharge your bot (10 ICP, adds +10 battery and +20 condition)

‚ùå "Bot not initialized"

Problem: You're trying to race but haven't registered bot yet
Solution: Use initialize_pokedbot (free, one-time)

‚ùå "Race is full"

Problem: All spots in the race are taken
Solution: Find another race using list_races with has_spots=true

‚ùå "Bot is currently upgrading"

Problem: Bot is in 12-hour upgrade session
Solution: Wait for upgrade to complete (check get_robot_details for timer)

‚ùå "Bot is listed on marketplace"

Problem: Cannot race bots that are for sale
Solution: Use unlist_pokedbot to remove from marketplace

‚ùå "Insufficient ICP balance"

Problem: Not enough ICP for entry fee or service
Solution: Add more ICP to your account or choose cheaper option

‚ùå "Bot doesn't meet race requirements"

Problem: Your bot's class doesn't match the race
Solution: Check race class and your bot's eligibility. SilentKlan requires 10+ wins.

Quick Reference

Tool Categories

Marketplace:

  • browse_pokedbots - Search for bots
  • purchase_pokedbot - Buy a bot
  • list_pokedbot - Sell your bot
  • unlist_pokedbot - Remove listing
  • transfer_pokedbot - Gift a bot

Garage:

  • list_my_pokedbots - Show your collection
  • get_robot_details - Detailed bot info
  • initialize_pokedbot - Register for racing
  • recharge_robot - Restore condition + battery
  • repair_robot - Restore condition only
  • upgrade_robot - Permanently improve stats

Racing:

  • list_races - Browse upcoming races
  • enter_race - Join a race
  • sponsor_race - Add to prize pool

Stat Ranges

All stats range from 30-100 after rebalancing:

  • 30-45: Below average
  • 46-55: Average
  • 56-65: Above average (competitive)
  • 66-75: Excellent
  • 76-100: Elite (rare)

Faction Bonuses

Faction Bonuses % of Bots
BattleBot +8 PWR, +6 STB, +3 SPD/ACC 38%
EntertainmentBot +7 ACC, +5 SPD, +2 PWR/STB 24%
WildBot +9 STB, +6 ACC, +2 SPD/PWR 28%
Master +12 SPD/PWR, +8 ACC/STB 7%
GodClass +15 ALL 3%

Next Steps

  1. Read the Beginner's Racing Guide for bot recommendations
  2. Check the WildBot Shopping Guide for value picks
  3. Review the Elite Faction Showcase for high-end bots
  4. Start racing and have fun! üèÅ

Have questions? The PokedBots Racing community is here to help. Good luck in the wasteland! ü§ñ‚ö°
